preamble: In this section, we will ask you about preprocessing decisions, such as analysis software, off-line filtering, re-referencing, artefact removal, epoching and baseline.  NOTE: If you notice a bug, or have a suggestion, we'd be grateful if you posted an issue on GitHub: https://github.com/INCF/artem-is/
question: Was the same software used for all pre-processing steps?
details: Preprocessing steps are fitlering, downsampling, re-referencing, artifact removal, epoching and baseline correction, and other up to the point of data collection. If you select YES here, you will be asked to provide the software information now, and if you select NO, you will be asked to specify software when describing each preprocessing step separately.

question: Which software was used for pre-processing?
Specify software version if applicable, script language if "custom script" was selected, and software name and version if "other" was selected.
Was an automated pre-processing pipeline which executes more preprocessing steps (e.g., not only artifact removal) used?
details: For example, this automated pipeline may also include filtering, baseline correction, or re-referencing.

question: Which automated pre-processing pipeline was used?
choices: PREP (Bigdely-Shamlo et al., 2015) | HAPPE (Gabard-Durnam et al., 2018) | HAPPE+ER (Monachino et al., 2021) | EPOS (Rodrigues et al., 2021) | other

question: Automated pre-processing pipeline that was used, other than listed
Reference for the automated pre-processing pipeline that was used
Version of the automated pre-processing pipeline, if applicable
Describe parameters and settings that were used to run this automated pipeline, if applicable, and any potential adjustments to the pipeline that may have been made manually.
Were any offline (digital) filters applied?
details: This does not include filtering within automated pipelines, if you had applied any, or filtering only for visualization, and not analysis purposes.

question: Which offline filters were applied?
Which software was used for implementing offline filters on EEG data?
Specify software version if applicable, script language if "custom script" was selected, and software name and version if "other" was selected.
What kind of impulse rate did the high-pass filter have?
What family of filters did the high-pass filter belong to?
Family of filters of the high-pass filter (other than listed above)
What was the order of the high-pass filter?
Type of high-pass filter cut-off
Offline high-pass filter cut-off
Offline high-pass filter roll off
Do you want to report any additional properties of the high-pass filter?
details: The properties listed above are the minumum required by recommendations for good practice by Keil et al. (2014), but providing additional information may help other researchers reproduce your filters if you know them.
Change_log: 27.11.2023 Angela: added this question in order to make it possible to remove "none of the above" option in the following question

question: Do you want to report any of these other additional offline high-pass filter properties?
details: These properties are not required by recommendations for good practice by Keil et al. (2014), but they may help other researchers reproduce your filters if you know them.
choices: attenuation in the stopband | transition bandwidth | passband ripple | filter direction | filter delay | other
Change_log: 25.08.2023 Angela: help instructions updated  27.11.2023 Angela: removed option "none of the above" to add the boolean question preceding this question instead, in order to make "other" the last option in the question. This has been done in order to give "other" the 999 code and not mess up options order in the process.

question: Attenuation achieved in the stopband after offline high-pass filtering
Offline high-pass filter transition bandwidth
Offline high-pass filter passband ripple
Direction of the offline high-pass filter
Offline high-pass filter delay
Describe offline high-pass filter properties other than properties offered above.
What kind of impulse rate did the low-pass filter have?
What family of filters did the low-pass filter belong to?
Family of filters of the low-pass filter (other than listed above)
What was the order of the low-pass filter?
Type of low-pass filter cut-off
Offline low-pass filter cut-off
Offline low-pass filter roll off
Do you want to report any additional properties of the low-pass filter?
details: The properties listed above are the minumum required by recommendations for good practice by Keil et al. (2014), but providing additional information may help other researchers reproduce your filters if you know them.
Change_log: 27.11.2023 Angela: added this question in order to make it possible to remove "none of the above" option in the following question

question: Do you want to report any of these other additional offline low-pass filter properties?
details: These properties are not required by recommendations for good practice by Keil et al. (2014), but they may help other researchers reproduce your filters if you know them. Select "none of the above" to mark this question as answered if you do not wish to add anything.
choices: attenuation in the stopband | transition bandwidth | passband ripple | filter direction | filter delay | other
Change_log: 25.08.2023 Angela: help instructions updated  27.11.2023 Angela: removed option "none of the above" to add the boolean question preceding this question instead, in order to make "other" the last option in the question. This has been done in order to give "other" the 999 code and not mess up options order in the process.

question: Attenuation achieved in the stopband after offline low-pass filtering
Offline low-pass filter transition bandwidth
Offline low-pass filter passband ripple
Direction of the offline low-pass filter
Offline low-pass filter delay
Describe offline low-pass filter properties other than properties offered above.
What notch filter was applied offline, after the recording?
Center frequency of the offline notch filter
In which format do you want to report the width of the offline notch filter?
choices: distance between 3 dB points | number of removed frequencies in a decrete Fourier transform

question: Distance between 3 dB points
Number of removed frequencies in a descrete Fourier transform
Were any harmonics also removed by the offline notch filter?
Which harmonics were removed by the offline notch filter? List center frequencies separated by a semicolon and a space
Was data downsampled?
What software was used for downsampling?
Specify software version if applicable, script language if "custom script" was selected and software name and version if "other" was selected.
If yes, what was the new sampling frequency?
Was data recorded from EEG electrodes re-referenced offline (after recording)?
details: This does not include re-referencing within automated pipelines, if you had applied any.

question: Which analysis software was used for re-referencing on EEG data?
Specify software version if applicable, script language if "custom script" was selected, and software name and version if "other" was selected.
What was the new reference?
details: EEG electrodes include cap electrodes, mastoids and/or earlobes, except for ground electrode.
choices: average mastoids | average earlobes | average of all EEG locations | reference electrode standardization technique (REST, Yao, 2001) | Cz | other

question: New reference other than listed
Was VEOG data re-referenced offline (after recording)?
details: This does not include re-referencing within automated pipelines, if you had applied any.

question: What was the new VEOG reference?
choices: bipolar (lower - upper VEOG) | the same reference as EEG electrodes | other | VEOG was not recorded

question: Which other reference was VEOG data re-referenced to?
Was HEOG data re-referenced offline (after recording)?
details: This does not include re-referencing within automated pipelines, if you had applied any.

question: What was the new HEOG reference?
choices: bipolar (left - right HEOG) | bipolar (right - left HEOG) | the same reference as EEG electrodes | other | HEOG was not recorded

question: Which other reference was HEOG data re-referenced to?
Was other non-EEG (and non-EOG) data re-referenced offline (after recording)?
details: This does not include re-referencing within automated pipelines, if you had applied any.

question: What was the new reference for other non-EEG (and non-EOG) data?
choices: the same reference as EEG electrodes | other | no non-EEG non-EOG electrodes were used

question: Which other reference was non-EEG (and non-EOG) data re-referenced to?
How many artifact elimination steps were there? You will describe each step in a separate tab right below.
details: This section refers to artifact removal (correction, rejection) methods other than elimating participants from the sample, which should be described in the Experimental design and sample section. This section should not include artifact removal within automated pipelines already described above.

question: What action was taken regarding artifacts in step 1?
choices: reject bad trial or bad data segment on all channels | correct by subtraction (blinks, EKG etc.) | reject channels | interpolate channels | multi-step automated approach (e.g., FASTER)

question: What software was used for artifact removal in step 1?
Specify software version if applicable, script language if "custom script" was selected and software name and version if "other" was selected.
Was rejection applied to trials or segments of continuous data in step 1?
How were artifacts defined in step 1?
choices: visual inspection | pre-set numerical criterion/function | other

question: Which artifacts were removed using visual inspection in step 1?
choices: blinks | saccades | other occular | cardiac | motion and other EMG noise | alpha waves | line noise | other

question: Which other artifacts were removed visually?
Describe the numerical criterion/function and provide numerical threshold(s) in step 1.
Describe method of artifact rejection that was used. Make sure that there is enough detail for a replication attempt.
Which general method of artifact correction was used in step 1?
choices: regression-based approach (e.g., Gratton et al., 1983, Elbert et al., 1985) | spatial-filter-based approach (e.g., Dale, 1994) | ICA-based approaches | wavelet-based | wavelet-enhanced ICA (e.g., Khushaba et al, 2013) | multiple-source-analysis-based approaches (e.g., MSEC by Berg & Scherg, 1994) | other

question: Reference to the artifact correction algorithm used in step 1
Describe artifact correction parameters in detail sufficient for replication.
details: For example, provide numerical parameters, options selected, or describe decision-making process as closely as possible if manual, visual-inspection based decisions were involved.

question: From which data were bad channels eliminated in step 1?
choices: from individual trials | from segments of continuous data | from the entire recording of a participant

question: Were there any channels that were eliminated for all participants?
List of channels eliminated in step 1 for all participants, separated by a semicolon and a space.
Percentage of channels eliminated per participant on average in step 1
What was the criterion for eliminating bad channels in step 1?
choices: visual inspection | pre-set numerical criterion/function | other

question: Why were bad channels removed in step 1?
choices: excessive line noise | excessive muscle activity | bad contact and other large fluctations in voltage | dead electrode | excessive EMG noise | cardiac activity | other

question: Which reasons, other than listed, were there for eliminating bad channels visually in step 1?
Describe the numerical criterion/function for eliminating channels and provide numerical threshold(s) in step 1.
Describe method of channel rejection.
details: Make sure that there is enough detail for a replication attempt.

question: How did you select channels for interpolation in step 1?
details: Describe the numerical threshold or function used to define which channels should be interpolated.

question: Describe interpolation function and the settings you used in step 1.
details: Provide appropriate details and settings, as well as a reference, if appropriate.

question: Reference to the automated artifact removal algorithm used in step 1
Describe automated artifact removal parameters in detail sufficient for replication.
details: For example, provide numerical parameters, options selected, or describe decision-making process as closely as possible if manual, visual-inspection based decisions were involved.

question: Were data epoched outside of the automated pre-processing pipelines described earlier?
Which analysis software was used for epoching EEG data?
Specify software version if applicable, script language if "custom script" was selected, and software name and version if "other" was selected.
What was the epoch beginning relative to a trigger point?
details: For timings after the trigger, use positive numbers. For timings before the trigger, use negative numbers.

question: What was the event type relative to which epochs were defined?
choices: stimulus onset | response | feedback onset | other

question: If other, what is the event?
What was the epoch end relative to a trigger point?
details: For timings after the trigger, use positive numbers. For timings before the trigger, use negative numbers.

question: Was baseline correction applied to the data (outside of the automated pre-processing pipelines described earlier)?
Which analysis software was used for baseline correction?
Specify software version if applicable, script language if "custom script" was selected, and software name and version if "other" was selected.
What was the baseline period beginning relative to a trigger point?
details: For timings after the trigger, use positive numbers. For timings before the trigger, use negative numbers.

question: What was the baseline period end relative to a trigger point?
details: For timings after the trigger, use positive numbers. For timings before the trigger, use negative numbers.

question: Which baseline calculation method was used?
choices: subtract mean of the baseline period per condition | other

question: Describe your baseline calculation method other than subtraction of the mean of the baseline.
Describe order of all pre-processing steps described here in a way that allows replication.
